topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538d682c6368727d04d30400#post_538d682c6368727d04d30400
[bq="Randomosaur"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538d67a76368727ddc000400#post_538d67a76368727ddc000400
Did you even read it?
[/bq]
Yes I have; the problem with it is that they're expecting a program to run without any actual coding.  I know I'm using a lot of analogies, but basically what we have now is essentially is a blank hard drive and people are wondering why their computer isn't immediately booting up to windows 9 when it hasn't even been developed yet and their hard drive is empty.

The people upset that we don't have human level intelligence Ai really need to back the fuck off and let people do their job.  No offence to you; I'm talking more along the lines of the people that still are whining that we don't have flying cars and time machine deloreans.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538d6aa66368727ddc900500#post_538d6aa66368727ddc900500
Darn it; I keep getting ninja'd tonight.  Why is everyone on during a school night?  You guys should be sleeping.




If anyone wants to know why we don't have sapient Ai summarized in one sentence it's this, "The 'programming language' for it is still being written"; the bricks for a house are still being made; the iron needed for steel is still being smelted; the chinese shoe factory worker is still making the individual parts of your shoes and hasn't even gotten to putting it together yet.  It's still going to be at LEAST fifteen more years until the 'programming language' is actually complete.

topics.body:
The following de-extinction projects currently have had very good progress.
"Woolly mammoth.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woolly_mammoth (Mammoth genes are currently being tested in elephant cells)
"Bucardo.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bucardo (One was cloned in 2009, but it died of lung defects after only 7 minutes)
"Gastric-brooding frog.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gastric-brooding_frog  (Embryos were cloned in 2013)
"Aurochs.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aurochs (Aurochs-like cattle are being bred and should soon be re-released into the forests of Europe)
"Quagga.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quagga (Quagga-like zebras are currently being bred)
